title: 112_s1175
content: The Act is titled the "21st Century Readiness Act" and includes findings. The "21st Century Readiness Act" emphasizes the importance of preparing students with core academic subjects fused with critical thinking, problem-solving, communication, collaboration, and creativity skills for success in the 21st century. This includes the development of voluntary national common standards in mathematics and English. The development of common standards in mathematics and English, emphasizing rigorous content and 21st-century skills, is a positive step. It should be a foundation for integrating these skills into other academic subjects in the future. Federal policy needs to support State leadership and encourage ongoing innovation. SEC. 3 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to include fusing core academic knowledge with higher-order thinking skills for real-world application. SEC. 4 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to evaluate college and career readiness by integrating core academic subjects with higher-order thinking skills for real-world application. SEC. 5 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to include a 21st century readiness initiative focusing on core academic subjects and higher-order thinking skills for real-world application. Section 1822(b)(1) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include implementing 21st century readiness initiatives that combine core academic knowledge with higher-order thinking skills for real-world application. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include high-quality professional development that integrates 21st century skills into daily instruction. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include high-quality professional development that integrates 21st century skills into daily instruction, enabling collaboration, constructing learning communities, utilizing expertise through coaching and mentoring, supporting educators as facilitators of learning, and using technology tools. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include high-quality professional development for educators to deliver instruction on higher-order thinking skills and use the latest technology. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include training for educators on delivering instruction on higher-order thinking skills, such as critical thinking and problem solving, in real-world contexts with technology integration. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include training for educators on integrating technology into curricula and instruction. SEC. 10 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include initiatives that allow students to apply various skill competencies alongside core academic subjects in real-world contexts, including using technology to improve student achievement. SEC. 11 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include developing or improving assessments that use technology to measure core academic subject knowledge and higher-order thinking skills in real-world contexts. The 21st Century Readiness Initiative is defined as an initiative that integrates core academic subjects with critical skills and focuses on preparing students for postsecondary education and careers upon graduation from secondary school.
